quest_title: An electrical meter of internal resistance 20\(\Omega\) gives a full scale deflection when 1mA current flows through it. The maximum current that can be measured by using three resistors each of 12\(\Omega\) in mA is
explanation_txt:
For maximum current the shunt should be least, so all resistance must be in parallel

\(\mathrm{S}=\cfrac{12}{3}=4 \Omega\)

\(\mathrm{I}_{\max }=\cfrac{(\mathrm{S}+\mathrm{G}) \mathrm{i}_{8}}{\mathrm{S}}=6 \mathrm{mA}\)

quest_title: \(\text{A\({}_{1}\)}\) g of an element give \(\text{A\({}_{2}\)}\) g of its oxide. The equivalent mass of the element is:
explanation_txt:
Mass of oxygen in the oxide = \(A_2-A_1\)

\(A_2-A_1\) gram of oxygen combines with \(A_1\) gram of element

1 gram of oxygen combines with \(\cfrac{A_1}{A_2-A_1}\) gram of the element.

Equivalent mass of oxygen = 8

\(\therefore\) 8 gram of oxygen combines with \(\cfrac{A_1}{A_2-A_1}\times 8\) gram of the element.

And as always 1 equivalent weight of an element combines with 1 equivalent weight of that compound.

Hence, equivalent weight of the element = \(\cfrac{A_1}{A_2-A_1}\times 8\)

quest_title: Let D be the middle point of the side BC of a triangle ABC. If the triangle ADC is equilateral, then \(a ^ { 2 } : b ^ { 2 } : c ^ { 2 } \) is equal to
explanation_txt:
\( \begin{array} { l } { \cos 120 ^ { \circ } = \cfrac { x ^ { 2 } + x ^ { 2 } - A B ^ { 2 } } { 2 x ^ { 2 } } } \\ { \Rightarrow \cfrac { 2 x ^ { 2 } - A B ^ { 2 } } { 2 x ^ { 2 } } = \cfrac { - 1 } { 2 } \Rightarrow 4 x ^ { 2 } - 2 A B ^ { 2 } = - 2 x ^ { 2 } } \end{array} \)

\( \begin{array} { l } { \Rightarrow 3 x ^ { 2 } = A B ^ { 2 } \Rightarrow A B = x \sqrt { 3 } } \\ { \Rightarrow a ^ { 2 } : b ^ { 2 } : c ^ { 2 } = ( 2 x ) ^ { 2 } : x ^ { 2 } : ( x \sqrt { 3 } ) ^ { 2 } } \\ { = 4 x ^ { 2 } : x ^ { 2 } : 3 x ^ { 2 } = 4 : 1 : 3 } \end{array} \)

[NOTE: If the median on longest side is equal to half the longest side, the triangle is right angled. ]

quest_title: A plane meets the co-ordinate axes in \(A,B,C\) and \((\alpha ,\beta ,\gamma )\) is the centered of the triangle \(ABC\). Then the equation of the plane is
explanation_txt:
Let the co-ordinates of the points where the plane cuts the axes are:

(\(\textit{a}\), 0, 0), (0, \(\textit{b}\), 0), (0, 0, \(\textit{c}\)).

Since centroid is \((\alpha ,\, \, \beta ,\, \, \gamma ),\) therefore \(a=3\alpha ,\, \)\(b=3\beta ,\, \, c=3\gamma .\)

Equation of the plane will be \(\cfrac{x}{a} +\cfrac{y}{b} +\cfrac{z}{c} =1\)

\(\Rightarrow \, \, \cfrac{x}{3\alpha } +\cfrac{y}{3\beta } +\cfrac{z}{3\gamma } =1 \\ \Rightarrow \, \, \cfrac{x}{\alpha } +\cfrac{y}{\beta } +\cfrac{z}{\gamma } =3.\)

explanation_plain_text:

(, 0, 0), (0, , 0), (0, 0, ).

quest_title: An express train is moving with a velocity v1. Its driver finds another train is moving on the same track in the same direction with velocity v2. To escape collision, driver applies a retardation a on the train. the minimum time of escaping collision will be
explanation_txt:
As the trains are moving in the same direction. So the initial relative speed \(\left( v _ { 1 } - v _ { 2 } \right)\) and by applying retardation final relative speed becomes zero.

From \(v = u - a t \Rightarrow 0 = \left( v _ { 1 } - v _ { 2 } \right) - a t \Rightarrow t = \cfrac { v _ { 1 } - v _ { 2 } } { a }\)

quest_title: A piece of steel sink 57.35% in mercury at 0\({}^{o}\)c. The % of it sink at 50\({}^{0}\)c if linear expansivity of steel is 12\(\times\)10\({}^{-6}\)/\({}^{o}\)c& cubical expansivity of mercury = 18\(\times\)10\({}^{-5}\)/\({}^{o}\)c
explanation_txt: \(\begin{aligned} \% \sin k &=57.35\left\{\cfrac{1+\gamma_{r} \times 50}{1+\gamma_{b} \times 50}\right\} \% \\ &=57.35\left\{\cfrac{1+18 \times 10^{-5} \times 50}{1+3 \times 12 \times 10^{-6} \times 50}\right\} \% \\ &=57.76 \% \end{aligned}\)

\(\Rightarrow\)\(a=\cfrac{qvB}{m} =\cfrac{1.6\times 10^{-19} \times 2\times 3.4\times 10^{7} }{1.67\times 10^{-27} } = 6.5 \times 10^{15}\)\(\textit{m/sec}\)\({}^{2}\)

quest_title: Pure inductances of 3.0 H are connected as shown in figure. The equivalent inductance of the circuit is
explanation_txt:
From figure it is clear that all three inductances are in parallel.
\(\cfrac{1}{L_{e q}}=\cfrac{1}{L_{1}}+\cfrac{1}{L_{2}}+\cfrac{1}{L_{3}}=\cfrac{1}{3}+\cfrac{1}{3}+\cfrac{1}{3}\)
\(\therefore L_{e q}=1 \mathrm{H} . \)

quest_title: The wavelength of radiation needed to jump the electron from 2\({}^{nd}\) orbit to 3\({}^{rd}\) orbit in hydrogen atom is
explanation_txt:
\(\cfrac{\mathrm{hc}}{\lambda}=\mathrm{E}_{3}-\mathrm{E}_{2}\)
or, \(\lambda=\cfrac{\mathrm{hc}}{\mathrm{E}_{3}-\mathrm{E}_{2}}=\cfrac{6.62 \times 10^{-34} \times 3 \times 10^{8}}{\left(\cfrac{-13.6}{9}+\cfrac{13.6}{4}\right) \times 1.6 \times 10^{-19}}\)
\(\quad=6.57 \times 10^{-7} \mathrm{m}\)

quest_title: If \(2 x - 4 y = 9\) and \(6 x - 12 y + 7 = 0\) are the tangents of same circle, then its radius will be
explanation_txt:
Since the tangents are parallel, therefore the distance between these two tangents will be its diameter.

\( D = \left | \cfrac{7+27}{\sqrt{36+144}} \right| \\ \Rightarrow D = \cfrac{17}{3 \sqrt 5 } \)

So, radius is \( \cfrac{17}{6\sqrt{5}} \)

quest_title: A blind person after walking each 10 steps in one direction each of length 80 cm turns randomly to left or right by 90\({}^{0}\) after walking a total of 40 steps, the maximum displacement of person from starting point is
explanation_txt: \(\begin{array}{l}{\text { Displacement of } 10 \text { steps }=10 \times 80=8 \mathrm{m}} \\ {\text { Total displacement along east }} \\ {\left(\vec{S}_{1}\right)=\mathrm{AB}+\mathrm{CD}=8+8=16 \mathrm{m}} \\ {\text { Total displacement along south }} \\ {\left(\vec{S}_{2}\right)=\mathrm{BC}+\mathrm{DE}=8+8=16 \mathrm{m}} \\ {\mathrm{S}=\sqrt{\mathrm{S}_{1}^{2}+\mathrm{S}_{2}^{2}}=\sqrt{16^{2}+16^{2}}=16 \sqrt{2} \mathrm{m}}\end{array}\)

quest_title: A river is flowing from east to west at a speed of 5 m/min. A man on south bank of river, capable of swimming 10m/min in still water, wants to swim across the river in shortest time. He should swim
ans3_txt: Due north-east with double the speed of river
explanation_txt:
For shortest time, swimmer should swim along AB with his maximum speed i.e. 10 m/min, so he will reach at point C due to the velocity of river.

i.e. he should swim due north.
question_plain_title: A river is flowing from east to west at a speed of 5 m/min. A man on south bank of river, capable of swimming 10m/min in still water, wants to swim across the river in shortest time. He should swim
explanation_plain_text:
For shortest time, swimmer should swim along AB with his maximum speed i.e. 10 m/min, so he will reach at point C due to the velocity of river.

i.e. he should swim due north.
ans3_plain_text: Due north-east with double the speed of river

quest_title: A player kicks a football of mass 0.5 kg which comes flying towards him with a velocity 10 m/s. If the impact last for 1/50 second and the ball bounces back with a velocity of 15 m/s, the average force is
explanation_txt:
\(\quad\)\(F\) = \( \cfrac{mv - \left(- mu\right)}{t} \)= \( \cfrac{m \left(v + u\right)}{t} \)

\(\quad\)\(F\) = \( \cfrac{mv - \left(- mu\right)}{t} \)= \( \cfrac{0.5 \left(10 + 15\right)}{1/50} \) = 625 N

quest_title: Water is flowing through a tube of non-uniform cross-section ratio of the radius at entry and exit end of the pipe is 3 : 2. Then the ratio of velocities at entry and exit of liquid is
explanation_txt:
If velocities of water at entry and exit points are v1 and v2, then according to equation of continuity,

\(A _ { 1 } v _ { 1 } = A _ { 2 } v _ { 2 } \Rightarrow \cfrac { v _ { 1 } } { v _ { 2 } } = \cfrac { A _ { 2 } } { A _ { 1 } } = \left( \cfrac { r _ { 2 } } { r _ { 1 } } \right) ^ { 2 } = \left( \cfrac { 2 } { 3 } \right) ^ { 2 } = \cfrac { 4 } { 9 }\)

quest_title: \(H_{2} O_{2} \) is used as
ans4_txt: An oxidant, a reductant and an acid
explanation_txt:
When H2O2 serves as an oxidizing agent, the oxygen is reduced to H2O.

When H2O2 serves as a reducing agent, the oxygen is oxidized to O2.

H2O2 is a weak acid, and it can form hydroperoxide or peroxide salts or derivatives of many metals.
question_plain_title: is used as

When H2O2 serves as a reducing agent, the oxygen is oxidized to O2.

H2O2 is a weak acid, and it can form hydroperoxide or peroxide salts or derivatives of many metals.
ans4_plain_text: An oxidant, a reductant and an acid

quest_title: 25ml of \(\text{H\(_{2}\)}\) and 18 ml of \(\text{I\(_{2}\)}\) were allowed to react at \(456^{0}\)C and at equilibrium 30.8 ml of HI is formed . the equilibrium constant of the reaction \(\text{H\(_{2}\)}\) + \(\text{I\(_{2}\)}\) \(\leftrightharpoons\) 2HI is
explanation_txt:
Given reaction is:

\(\begin{matrix} & H_2 &+ & I_2 &\rightleftharpoons &2HI \\ V_0 : & 25ml & & 18 ml & & 0 \\ V : & 25-x & & 18 -x & & 2x \end{matrix}\)

By given, \(2x=30.8 \Rightarrow x=15.4\)

So,

\(K_c = \cfrac{30.8^2}{(25-15.4)(18-15.4)} = 38\)

\(\begin{array} { l } { \text { Given } f ( x ) = ( x - 1 ) ( x - 2 ) ^ { 2 } } \\ { f ( x ) = ( x - 1 ) \left( x ^ { 2 } + 4 - 4 x \right) ; f ( x ) = \left( x ^ { 3 } - 5 x ^ { 2 } + 8 x - 4 \right) } \\ { \text { Now } f ' { ( x ) } = 3 x ^ { 2 } - 10 x + 8 , f ^ { \prime } ( x ) = 0 } \\ { \Rightarrow 3 x ^ { 2 } - 10 x + 8 = 0 \Rightarrow ( 3 x - 4 ) ( x - 2 ) = 0 \Rightarrow x = \cfrac { 4 } { 3 } , 2 } \end{array}\)

\(\begin{array} { l } { \text { Now } \quad f ^ { \prime \prime } ( x ) = 6 x - 10 } \\ { f ^ { \prime \prime } ( 4 / 3 ) = 6 \times 4 / 3 - 10 < 0 } \\ { f ^ { \prime \prime } ( 2 ) = 12 - 10 > 0 } \\ { \text { Hence at } x = \cfrac { 4 } { 3 } \text { the function will occupy maximum value. } } \\ { \therefore \text { Maximum value } = f ( 4 / 3 ) = 4 / 27 } \end{array}\)

quest_title: The count rate of a radioactive source at t = 0 was 1600 count/sec and at t = 8 sec it was 100 count/sec. The count rate at t = 6 sec will be
explanation_txt:
\(\cfrac{C}{C_{o}}=\left(\cfrac{1}{2}\right)^{\cfrac{t}{T_{1 / 2}}}\)
or, \(\cfrac{100}{1600}=\left(\cfrac{1}{2}\right)^{\cfrac{8}{T_{1 / 2}}}\)
or, \(4=\cfrac{8}{T_{1 / 2}}\)
or, \(T_{1 / 2}=2 s\)
Again, \(\cfrac{C^{\prime}}{C_{o}}=\left(\cfrac{1}{2}\right)^{\cfrac{t}{T_{1/2}}}\)
or, \(C^{\prime}=1600\left(\cfrac{1}{2}\right)^{\cfrac{6}{2}}=200\,\text{count/s}\)

quest_title: The volume of glass flask is 240cc at 0\({}^{o}\)C volume of mercury at 0\({}^{o}\)C should be kept in the flask so that volume of empty part of flask may remain unchanged on heating or cooling (\(\alpha\)of glass = 8\(\times\)10\({}^{-6}\)/\({}^{o}\)C&\(\mathrm{\gamma}\)\({}_{r}\) of mercury = 18\(\times\)10\({}^{-5}\)/\({}^{o}\)C)

quest_title: Points \(\text{A}\) and \(\text{B}\) are situated along the extended axis of a 2 cm long bar magnet at a distance \(\text{x}\) and 2\(\text{x}\) cm respectively from the pole nearer to the points. The ratio of the magnetic field at \(\text{A}\) and \(\text{B}\) will be
explanation_txt:
\(B=\cfrac{\mu_{0}}{2 \pi} \cfrac{2 M}{r^{3}}\)
where, \(r=\) distance of the point from centre of magnet
\(B_{A}=\cfrac{\mu b}{2 \pi} \times \cfrac{2 M}{(x+1)^{3}}\)
and \(B_{B}=\cfrac{\mu b}{2 \pi} \times \cfrac{2 M}{(2 x+1)^{3}}\)
\(\therefore \cfrac{B_{A}}{B_{B}}=\left(\cfrac{2 x+1}{x+1}\right)^{3} \approx \cfrac{(2 x)^{3}}{x^{3}} \approx 8: 1\)
